thread.title: Report: Baylor football passing coordinator Jeff Lebby will call plays against Lamar
thread.title_full: Report: Baylor football passing coordinator Jeff Lebby will call plays against Lamar | Dallas Morning News

author: Shehan Jeyarajah
title: Report: Baylor football passing coordinator Jeff Lebby will call plays against Lamar
text:
Baylor football will be without offensive coordinator Kendal Briles and wide receiver coach Tate Wallis for the Bears' game on Saturday evening against Lamar after the duo were suspended by head coach Art Briles for a recruiting violation.
The younger Briles took over playcalling duties after former offensive coordinator Phil Montgomery left to become head coach at Tulsa. In his absence, Baylor passing game coordinator and running back coach Jeff Lebby will call offensive plays on Saturday during Baylor's game against Lamar, according to a report from the Waco Tribune-Herald.
Lebby has been with Briles since his arrival at Baylor in 2008. He first was in charge of quality control and was the NFL liason. In 2012, Lebby was promoted to a full assistant coach in charge of the running backs. The Bears have featured at least one 1,000-yard rusher in every season since the change.
Lebby was named one of the top 10 recruiters in the Big 12 by Rivals in 2014. In early 2015, he was promoted to passing game coordinator and offensive recruiting coordinator. However, this will be his first game as a playcaller for Baylor football.
After serving their one-game suspension, Kendal Briles and Wallis are both expected to be back in time for Baylor's Sept. 26 game against Rice.
